result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: Letter from Atty Jensen advising the Office of the State Public Defender no longer represents Defendant.

Returned Judgment of Dismissal/Acquittal as Addressed to Brandon T Hermance 
Released from Waukesha County Jail. Clerk Found Most Recent Address and Forwarded

ADDRESS INFO for Brandon T Hermance
Current: 500 Western Avenue, Watertown, WI 53094 United States  (Effective: 07-12-2022)
Prior: 515 W Moreland Blvd, C/O Waukesha Co Jail, Waukesha, WI 53188 United States

09:48 AM Defendant Brandon T Hermance in court, in custody, with attorney Jeffrey W. Jensen.    District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Dismissed and Read-in to:  22CM74

02:30 PM; Case called for Bail/bond hearing.  Defendant Brandon T Hermance in court, in custody at WCJ, with attorney Jeffrey W. Jensen.    District Attorney's Office Law Intern Jack Rieder appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court notes the matter is before the Court on Defense Motion to Modify Bail.  Atty. Jensen confirms and presents arguments; he is asking to have cash bond modified to a signature bond and that the matter be set for plea and sentencing as soon as possible.  State opposes any modification to bail and presents arguments.  Atty. Jensen presents additional statements.  Court places its findings on the record.  For reasons placed on the record the Court will deny the Motion to Modify bail; bail will remain as previously set.  Court notes it can set the matter over for further proceedings, but if defense files a signed plea questionnaire and files it with the Court it will try to set a sooner date for plea and sentencing.  Hearing scheduled for August 1, 2022 at 11:00 am.
Bail/bond hearing on June 29, 2022 at 02:30 pm.
